org.osframework.spring.chronicle

Class AbstractChronicleBuilderBean<K,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AbstractFactoryBean<T>
      • org.osframework.spring.chronicle.AbstractChronicleBuilderBean<K,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key type of Chronicle collection to be built
    T - Type of Chronicle collection to be built
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Aware, BeanClassLoaderAware, BeanFactoryAware, DisposableBean, FactoryBean<T>, InitializingBean
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChronicleMapBuilderBean, ChronicleSetBuilderBean

    public abstract class AbstractChronicleBuilderBean<K,T>
extends AbstractFactoryBean<T>
    Abstract superclass of Chronicle collection FactoryBean classes.
    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Dave Joyce

      • setKeyMarshaller

        public void setKeyMarshaller(net.openhft.lang.io.serialization.BytesMarshaller<? super K> keyMarshaller)
        Set the BytesMarshaller used to serialize/deserialize keys to/from off-heap memory in the collection instance created by this object. See the section about serialization in ChronicleMap manual for more information.
        Parameters:
        keyMarshaller - marshaller used to serialize keys

      • setAverageKeySize

        public void setAverageKeySize(double averageKeySize)
        Set the average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys, put into the collection instance this object builds. If key size is always the same, call setConstantKeySizeBySample(Object) method instead of this one.

        If key is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if key size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        averageKeySize - average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if argument is not positive number
        IllegalStateException - if sample key has been specified

      • setConstantKeySizeBySample

        public void setConstantKeySizeBySample(K sampleKey)
        Set the constant number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys, put into the collection instance this object builds. If key size varies, call setAverageKeySize(double) method instead of this one. By providing the sampleKey, all keys should take the same number of bytes in serialized form, as this sample object.

        If key is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if key size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        sampleKey - sample key with constant number of bytes for all keys
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if avg key size has been specified

      • setMaxEntries

        public final void setMaxEntries(long maxEntries)
        Set maximum number of entries contained by the collection instances created by this object.
        Parameters:
        maxEntries - maximum number of map entries
        See Also:
        ChronicleHashBuilder.entries(long)

      • setEntriesPerSegment

        public final void setEntriesPerSegment(long entriesPerSegment)
        Set actual maximum number of entries that could be inserted into any single segment of collection instances created by this object. Configuring both the actual number of entries per segment and actual segments replaces a single setMaxEntries(long) configuration.

        This is a low-level configuration.

        Parameters:
        entriesPerSegment - actual maximum number of entries per segment in maps constructed by this object
        See Also:
        setMaxEntries(long), setActualSegments(int)

      • setActualChunksPerSegment

        public final void setActualChunksPerSegment(long actualChunksPerSegment)
        Set the actual number of chunks that will be reserved for any single segment of the collection instances created by this object. This configuration is a lower-level version of setEntriesPerSegment(long).

        Setting this property makes sense only if setActualChunkSize(int), setActualSegments(int), and setEntriesPerSegment(long) are also configured manually.

        Parameters:
        actualChunksPerSegment - the actual number of chunks reserved per segment in the collection instances created by this object

      • setActualSegments

        public final void setActualSegments(int actualSegments)
        Set the actual number of segments in collection instances created by this object. With actual number of segments, this configuration replaces a single setMaxEntries(long) call.

        This is a low-level configuration.

        Parameters:
        actualSegments - actual number of segments in maps constructed by this object
        See Also:
        setEntriesPerSegment(long)

      • setMinSegments

        public final void setMinSegments(int minSegments)
        Set minimum number of segments in collection instances created by this object.
        Parameters:
        minSegments - minimum number of segments in maps constructed by this object

      • setActualChunkSize

        public final void setActualChunkSize(int actualChunkSize)
        Set the size in bytes of the allocation unit of collection instances this object builds.

        To minimize memory overuse and improve speed, one should pay decent attention to this configuration. Alternatively, just trust the heuristics and don't configure the chunk size.

        Specify chunk size so that most entries would take from 5 to several dozens of chunks. However, remember that operations with entries that span several chunks are a bit slower, than with entries which take a single chunk. Particularly avoid entries to take more than 64 chunks.

        Parameters:
        actualChunkSize - the "chunk size" in bytes
        See Also:
        ChronicleHashBuilder.actualChunkSize(int)

      • setMaxChunksPerEntry

        public final void setMaxChunksPerEntry(int maxChunksPerEntry)
        Set how many chunks a single entry inserted into collection instances created by this object could take. An attempt to insert a larger entry causes IllegalStateException. This is useful as a self-check that chunk size is configured correctly and that keys and values take expected number of bytes.

        For example, if setConstantKeySizeBySample(Object) is configured or key size is statically known to be constant (boxed primitives, data value generated implementations, Byteables, etc.), and the same is true for value objects, max chunks per entry is configured to 1, to ensure keys and values are actually constantly-sized.

        Parameters:
        maxChunksPerEntry - how many chunks a single entry could span at most

      • setLockTimeOut

        public final void setLockTimeOut(String lockTimeOut)
        Set timeout of locking on segments of collection instances created by this object, when performing any queries, as well as bulk operations like iteration.

        Timeout expression

        Valid timeout expressions are composed of a long amount and a standard time unit abbreviation. Examples:

         100ns - 100 nanoseconds
 300µs - 300 microseconds
 500ms - 500 milliseconds
   10s -  10 seconds
    2m -   2 minutes
    1h -   1 hour
        Parameters:
        lockTimeOut - lock timeout expression
        See Also:
        LockTimeOutParser

      • setObjectSerializer

        public void setObjectSerializer(net.openhft.lang.io.serialization.ObjectSerializer objectSerializer)
        Set serializer used to serialize both keys and values in ChronicleMap instances created by this object, if they require:
        • loose typing
        • nullability

        Set this only if custom key and value marshallers are not configured.

        Parameters:
        objectSerializer - generic serializer of entry keys and values

      • setErrorListener

        public final void setErrorListener(ChronicleHashErrorListener errorListener)
        Set listener to be fired on error events in collection instances created by this object.
        Parameters:
        errorListener - error event listener

      • setPersistedTo

        public final void setPersistedTo(Resource persistedTo)
        Set filesystem location to which the collection instance will persist its entries off-heap. The specified value must resolve to a File that is readable and writable.
        Parameters:
        persistedTo - off-heap entry storage filesystem location

      • setPersistedTo

        public final void setPersistedTo(File persistedTo)
        Set filesystem location to which the collection instance will persist its entries off-heap. The specified value must be a File that is readable and writable.
        Parameters:
        persistedTo - off-heap entry storage filesystem location

      • setImmutableKeys

        public final void setImmutableKeys(boolean immutableKeys)
        Toggle whether key objects of entries in collection instances created by this object are inherently immutable.
        Parameters:
        immutableKeys - flag indicating whether entry keys are immutable
        See Also:
        ChronicleHashBuilder.immutableKeys()

      • setMetaDataBytes

        public final void setMetaDataBytes(int metaDataBytes)
        Set number of bytes allocated for metadata per entry in collection instances created by this object. The value must be in the range [0..255].
        Parameters:
        metaDataBytes - number of bytes allocated for metadata per map entry

        protected abstract <C extends AbstractChronicleBuilderBean.AbstractBuilderConfig> C getConfig()
